main event: A red flickering light, resembling the size of the North Star, was observed disappearing and reappearing twice near the star Altair in the Milky Way.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 51 seconds, The object was noted to have no sound or radar confirmation, The observer was on duty at a radar site, The object traveled from northwest to southeast and faded into the Milky Way, There was insufficient data to evaluate the nature of the object.
location: North Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada
witness description: observer on skywatch duty at a radar site
